title: What will be a single discount equivalent to three successive discounts of 5%,10% and 20%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends..…! Let selling price be ₹100 First Discount 5% = 5 × 100/100 = ₹5 Price after first discount = ₹100 – 5 = ₹95 Second discount 10% on price after first discount = 10/100 × 95 = ₹9.50 Price after second discount = ₹95 – 9.50 = ₹85.50 Third discount 20% on price after second discount = 20/100 × 85.50 = ₹17.10 Price after third discount = ₹85.50 – ₹17.10 = ₹68.40 Single disocunt combining all three discount will be = 100 — 68.40 = ₹31.60 As selling price taken was ₹100 therefore discount will be 31.60% Answer: Single disocunt combining all three discount is 31.60%

The three successive discount means first one discount then second and so on. Let us assume the first discount is 5%, second 10% and lastly 20%. ( In practice I see that discounts are offered on the printed price during sales in reverse order ie first 20%, next 10% and lastly 5%.) Let us say the price is 100. After a discount of 5% the price becomes (100–5)= 95. On this 95 a discount of 10% the price becomes 95-9.50=85.50. Again on this price of 85.50 a discount of 20% the price becomes 85.50–17.10=68.40. Thus the final price after the successive discounts is 68.40 on an initial price of 100. Therefore the net discount on a price of 100 is 100–68.40=31.60%. If the successive discounts are offered the other way the prices will be first 100–20=80; next 80–8=72 and 72–14.40=57.60. The final net discount in this case will be 100–57.60=42.40%.
